name.value: DCH Blood Spot Outcome MSUD SnCT

description.value: A code from the SNOMED Clinical Terminology UK coding system that describes the outcome of the blood spot screening for maple syrup urine disease.

copyright.value: This value set includes content from SNOMED CT, which is copyright Â© 2002+ International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO), and distributed by agreement between IHTSDO and HL7. Implementer use of SNOMED CT is not covered by this agreement.

display.value: Newborn blood spot specimen received
Maple syrup urine disease screening declined
Maple syrup urine disease screening declined, no history of being screened
Maple syrup urine disease screening declined, screened in UK (as reported by parents) with no evidence of result
Maple syrup urine disease screening declined, screened outside UK with evidence of result
Maple syrup urine disease screening declined, screened outside UK with no evidence of result
Maple syrup urine disease screening, repeat screening with further sample required
Maple syrup urine disease screening, too young for reliable screening
Maple syrup urine disease screening, sample taken too soon after blood transfusion (less than 72 hours)
Maple syrup urine disease screening, insufficient sample
Maple syrup urine disease screening, unsuitable sample (blood quality): incorrect blood application
Maple syrup urine disease screening, unsuitable sample (blood quality): compressed/damaged
Maple syrup urine disease screening, unsuitable sample: day 0 and day 5 on same card
Maple syrup urine disease screening, unsuitable sample: NHS number missing/not accurately recorded
Maple syrup urine disease screening, unsuitable sample: date of sample missing/not accurately recorded
Maple syrup urine disease screening, unsuitable sample: date of birth not accurately matched
Maple syrup urine disease screening, unsuitable sample: expired card used
Maple syrup urine disease screening, unsuitable sample: more than 14 days in transit, too old for analysis
Maple syrup urine disease screening, unsuitable sample: damaged in transit
Maple syrup urine disease not suspected
Maple syrup urine disease not suspected and other disorders follow up required
Suspected maple syrup urine disease
Maple syrup urine disease not screened for or screening incomplete
Maple syrup urine disease not screened for or screening incomplete: over 1 year old, too old for screening
Maple syrup urine disease not screened for or screening incomplete, moved out of area
Maple syrup urine disease not screened for or screening incomplete, not contactable, reasonable efforts made
Maple syrup urine disease not screened for or screening incomplete, baby died
Maple syrup urine disease not screened for or screening incomplete, not required, previous valid result
